page.description: The .INDEX_ADD() method adds another index tag to the index file created by TABLE.INDEX_CREATE_BEGIN() .
page.syntax: V Index_Add(C Tagname,C Order_expression[,C Filter_expression[,C Index_Type]])

argument.name: Tagname
argument.description: The name of an existing index.

argument.name: Order_expression
argument.description: A character order expression that sorts selected records.

argument.name: Filter_expression
argument.description: Optional. Default = all entries. A character filter expression that selects index entries.

argument.name: Index_Type
argument.description: Optional. Default = "" (Ascending, not unique). A string of character flags that can specify a descending sort order.

section.note: There are higher level functions that may be easier to use. See GET_INDEX_DEFINITIONS(), INDEXES_MATCH_DEFSTRING(), and CREATE_INDEXES().

section.title: Example
section.description: Create a new production index file with a first name and a last name index tag.
section.example: tbl = table.current() table.index_create_begin("LASTNAME", "LAST_NAME") index_add("FIRSTNAME", "FIRST_NAME") index1 = tbl.index_create_end()

section.description: Create a new temporary index file, but explicitly name the index file so that it is not the production index. Filter the index for state = CA, and include unique keys only.
section.example: tbl = table.current() table.index_create_begin("CA customers", "LAST_NAME", "State_prov = 'CA'", "U") index2 = tbl.index_create_end(a_DB_current_PATH + "temp.cdx")
